reasoning: The stated “critique” does not attack the position; it essentially restates one of the position’s own counterarguments (#2: longer-run estimates imply higher substitutability / rho closer to 0, weakening compute-bottleneck claims). So its centrality-as-a-refutation is ~0 and it provides ~0 strength against the position. The claim itself is reasonably plausible (and consistent with cited economic discussion), though not established here, so correctness is moderate-high. It is clear, focused on a single issue, and contains no extraneous material.
title: Long-run empirical estimates of near-zero correlation undermine the negative correlation assumption
